name: The Remains of Richard Fleming
description:
This game natively runs at 1080p. There is a fullscreen button in the bottom right hand corner. Press Play. If you cannot see it, just zoom out your browser and you will find it.

Overview

The Remains of Richard Fleming is a narrative detective game built for Charlmes' I Can't Write But Want To Tell A Story. The theme of the Jam was lost and this game is all about lost information which you have to piece together.  The competition features a 'duck' category. You can find the 'duck' in the fourth audio call. A duck is a British cricket term for no rounds (or points) scored when batting.

The game should run at around 15 minutes. I cannot stress enough, please do not guess. All the answers are there if you listen and look closely. If you are not a native English speaker, you may want to Google a few things also. 

Credits:

Art, Code, Music - Tim Sheinman (Owl_Skip)

Voice Work - Larry Rickard, John Doy, Tim Sheinman]

Notes

This game is obviously enormously inspired by the work of John LeCarre and Graham Greene. If you enjoyed it, I suggest you seek out their novels and adapatations for TV and Screen.
